{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3441345,"name":"Declan Dunn","username":"Declan0811","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/declan0811/{size}/213245_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-29T19:10:42.919Z","cooked":"

I’m just trying to set up my team’s new MAXSwerve drives, and I’ve been slowly working through issues, but this is one that is really odd. I’ve run multiple simulators, and have switched over to AdvantageKit logger trying to figure this stuff out. The issue comes up when I try and run simulations in my drivestation through field2d or through advantagescope, where the robot moves very oddly when being told to move in a direction, so when I go to advantagescope, this is proven when the actual vs targeted drives are way off. Any help?

Our github repo

Screencap of weirdness

Pretty sure its bc of this

github.com

Archimedes-Robotics/Robot-2025/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/MAXSwerveModule.java#L29


      
    
          
  1. public class MAXSwerveModule {
    2. 
          
  2.   private final CANSparkMax m_drivingSparkMax;
    3. 
          
  3.   private final CANSparkMax m_turningSparkMax;
    4. 
          
  4. 
          
  5.   private final RelativeEncoder m_drivingEncoder;
    6. 
          
  6.   private final AbsoluteEncoder m_turningEncoder;
    7. 
          
  7. 
          
  8.   private final SparkPIDController m_drivingPIDController;
    9. 
          
  9.   private final SparkPIDController m_turningPIDController;
    10. 
          
  10. 
          
  11.   private double m_chassisAngularOffset = 0;
    12. 
          
  12.   private SwerveModuleState m_desiredState = new SwerveModuleState(0.0, new Rotation2d());
    13. 
          
  13. 
          
  14.   /**
    15. 
          
  15.    * Constructs a MAXSwerveModule and configures the driving and turning motor, encoder, and PID
    16. 
          
  16.    * controller. This configuration is specific to the REV MAXSwerve Module built with NEOs, SPARKS
    17. 
          
  17.    * MAX, and a Through Bore Encoder.
    18. 
          
  18.    */
    19. 
          
  19.   public MAXSwerveModule(int drivingCANId, int turningCANId, double chassisAngularOffset) {
    20. 
          
  20.     m_drivingSparkMax = new CANSparkMax(drivingCANId, MotorType.kBrushless);
    21. 
          
  21.     m_turningSparkMax = new CANSparkMax(turningCANId, MotorType.kBrushless);
    22.
github.com

Archimedes-Robotics/Robot-2025/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/Constants.java#L48-L52


      
    
          
  1. // Angular offsets of the modules relative to the chassis in radians
    2. 
          
  2. public static final double kFrontLeftChassisAngularOffset = -Math.PI / 2;
    3. 
          
  3. public static final double kFrontRightChassisAngularOffset = 0;
    4. 
          
  4. public static final double kBackLeftChassisAngularOffset = Math.PI;
    5. 
          
  5. public static final double kBackRightChassisAngularOffset = Math.PI / 2;
    6.

MAXSwerve doesn’t play nicely with offsets that aren’t burned into the SparkMAX from my experience. I really don’t know why.

Looking at this more, this is from the MAXSwerve template. I guess so teams can use their calibration tool and have it work with little problems. Assuming that works i don’t see what is happening in your current codebase.

FYI If you switch to your own code or a library you will still have to deal with setting the offsets via the REV Hardware client, just without the physical tool they provide.
